results.title: The Rescuers
results.creator_credit: Art Stevens, John Lounsbery, Wolfgang Reitherman and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Courageous rescues are the specialty of secret agent mice, Bernard and Bianca. An innocent orphan named Penny is kidnapped by Madame Medusa, a wickedly wacky villainess. Madame Medusa needs Penny to recover a priceless jewel. Bernard and Bianca set out to save Penny from Madame Medusa’s evil clutches. Voices are provided by Bob Newhart, Eva Gabor and Geraldine Page. Animated.

results.title: The Karate kid
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen, Jerry Weintraub and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Daniel, a fatherless teenager, arrives in Los Angeles from the East Coast and faces the difficult task of making new friends. He becomes the object of bullying by a menacing gang of karate students, the Cobras, when he strikes up a relationship with the leader’s ex-girlfriend, Ali. Daniel’s handyman, Miyagi, a master of martial arts teaches him karate and that fighting is always the last answer to a problem. Daniel learns that karate is a mastery over the self, mind and body, and develops physical skills as well as faith and self-confidence.

results.title: Flight of the navigator
results.creator_credit: Randal Kleiser, Dimitri Villard, Robby Wald, New Star Entertainment, Viking Film and PSO
results.brief_description: A 12 year old boy is mysteriously abducted by an alien ship and returns to earth eight years later, still only 12. He now possesses great navigational powers that enable him to fly his spaceship anywhere he desires. Along with the robotic commander Max and mascot Puckmarin, David encounters an adventure of extraterrestrial proportions. Based on the story by Mark H. Baxter. Cast includes Joey Cramer, Sarah Jessica Parker, Veronica Cartwright, Cliff de Young, Matt Adler, Howard Hesseman.

results.title: Fluteman
results.creator_credit: Peter Maxwell, Brendon Lunney and Independent Productions (AU)
results.brief_description: Minyaka is a town in need of miracles and happiness. Desperate for water and ruled by dishonest councillors they cannot even afford a swimming pool. A mysterious stranger, known only as the ‘Fluteman’ promises that he can create rain, for a cost. The councillors, (not believing his promise) agree to the sum of $5,000. The Fluteman creates rain, much the the relief of Minyaka. The councillors refuse to pay the amount promised however and Fluteman, like the Pied Piper of Hamelin, leads the children out of town in retaliation. Only a young school teacher with the assistance of her mute student can locate the children and expose the councillors to the rest of the township.

results.title: Smoke
results.creator_credit: Wayne Wang, Peter Newman, Greg Johnson, Euro Space and Neue Deutsche Filmgesellschaft
results.brief_description: Wayne Wang’s “Smoke” is a beautifully crafted film that weaves together the stories of a group of characters whose lives intersect at Augie Wren’s (Harvery Keitel) cigar shop. Paul Benjamin (William Hurt) is a writer who is trying to recover from the death of his wife. He runs into ‘Rasheed’ who is looking for his father. Meanwhile Ruby McNutt (Stockard Channing) is trying to convince Augie that her heroin addicted daughter is his. Keitel acts as an anchoring force in “Smoke” as the characters’ stories unfold lesuirely and lovingly. (Awards: Winner of the 1995 Berlin Film Festival International Critics Prize and Special Jury Prize)

results.title: Emily Bronte's Wuthering Heights
results.creator_credit: Peter Kosminsky, Mary Selway and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: This colorful adaptation of Emily Bronte’s timeless novel follows the structure of the original story. Cathy and Heathcliff are childhood sweathearts whose love in adulthood is thwarted by the social conditions and expectations surrounding them. Ralph Fiennes and Juliette Binoche are beautiful to watch although they don’t catch the intensity of the doomed lovers of Wuthering Heights. The Yorkshire moors make a picturesque backdrop and Ryuichi Sakamoto supplies beautiful music.

results.title: Anne Frank remembered
results.creator_credit: Jon Blair, Disney Channel, BBC and Jon Blair Film Company
results.brief_description: Anne Frank has been described as one of the icons of the 20th century with her diary the second most read book of Western non-fiction after the Bible. Narrated by Kenneth Brannagh, with Glenn Close reading excerpts from the famous bestseller, John Blair’s film is effective in placing Anne’s story firmly in its 20th century context. This is not just her life in Holland and her death in a Nazi concentration camp, but the impact the diary has had in the half century since. Suitable for Upper Secondary level student, this packi includes a comprehensive study guide.

results.title: Spotswood
results.creator_credit: Mark Joffe, Timothy White, Richard Brennan, Smiley Films and Meridian Films
results.brief_description: Spotswood is an ordinary place where nobody is ordinary, and where business as usual is very unusual! Anthony Hopkins plays Wallace, a time and motion expert who has come to Spotswood to turn the workers at the local moccasin factory from a bunch of eccentric oddballs, into a well-oiled working machine. This quirky film has a great cast, including Ben Mendelshon, Russell Crowe, Bruno Lawrence and Alwyn Kurts and is an epic saga sweeping two suburbs that is refreshing and uplifting comedy at its best!

results.title: Alvin Purple
results.brief_description: The Australian film revival did not begin with “Picnic at Hanging Rock” but with ocker comedy seen in “Stork”, “Barry McKenzie” and “Alvin Purple”. The latter remains one of the most profitable Australian films yet produced. Its popularity clearly reflected the moment - with the relaxation of censorship in the early seventies, a high spirited sex comedy in the Australian idiom had special appeal for Australian audiences. Alvin (Graeme Blundell) is an ordinary young man desiring a quiet life whose very ordinariness seems irresistible to women. The comedy is based on incongruity. Sex is rendered as slapstick. Jokes are at the expense of bastions of hypocrisy - psychiatry, the press and the law. The would-be recessive hero is the object of male sexual fantsy - sex without responsibility - a fantasy with which women could also apparently identify.

results.title: A Ticket in tatts
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film stars George Wallace as a disaster-prone stablehand who owns a whistle that can make Cup favorite Hotspur run faster. A sub-plot of the film concerns a high society romance where a young girl has undertaken to marry an ageing suitor if his horse defeats Hotspur in the Cup. Much of the shooting for this film was taken away from the usual studio scene to location scenes at a stud farm near Melbourne, the Flemington racecourse and in the grounds of a palatial Melbourne villa.
